projects.title: Tianmi - Nouveau Casino
projects.description: Live footage of artist Tianmi performing during her concert at Nouveau Casino.

projects.title: Maison Des Lycéens - Jaudré Rudel - Blaye

projects.title: Luidji - Adidas
projects.description: Live photo coverage of artist Luidji's performance during an event for the Adidas brand on Music Day.

projects.title: Typex
projects.description: Explore letters as graphic material and transform a surrealist sentence into an experimental composition. Discover three methods of intervention: manual, photocopier, scanner. Produce an edited record of your research and a final A3 poster using only manual collage. For this project, I started from the premise that the surrealist sentence was less a message than a material. Each workshop forced me to manipulate it differently: with my hands, with the machine, with the scanner. The goal was not to obtain a “correct” result, but to see how far the sentence could be distorted while retaining its presence. I multiplied the variations to observe how each technique produced a particular aesthetic: loss of contrast, glitch, superimposition, fragmentation, etc. The edition serves to organize this experimental chaos and show its stages. As for the poster, I constructed it as a synthesis: a version where the phrase remains perceptible, but integrated into an expressive graphic composition. The whole meets the requirements through its diversity, its format, and the presence of a strong final result.

projects.title: Poster - duality
projects.description: This poster explores the concept of duality through typographic composition. Large overlapping letterforms create a visual tension between black and white, using positive and negative space as the main graphic language. The contrast, fragmentation, and interlocking shapes visually express opposition, coexistence, and balance within a single layout.

projects.title: Graphic charter - Poster - Le jour de la nuit
projects.description: This project consists of designing the visual identity for “Le Jour de la Nuit,” an environmental event encouraging cities and citizens to switch off artificial lighting to raise awareness about light pollution. The concept is based on the connection between light and darkness, expressed through strong contrasts and structural typography. The project includes a poster, logotype, and application guidelines to ensure an impactful visual identity.

projects.title: Gray cardboard model - glimmer of hope
projects.description: This project explores the idea of “microclimate” as an inner emotional and mental environment rather than a geographic space. The model takes the form of a triangular tunnel made from grey cardboard, where tearing, folding, layering, and fragmentation represent obstacles, tension, and fragility along a personal journey toward a goal. A light positioned at the end of the structure symbolizes hope, achievement, and perseverance, while the projected shadows evoke doubts, fears, and complexity. The piece creates a physical metaphor for progression through difficulty toward clarity and resolution.

projects.title: Article Armande Barthe
projects.description: A double-page editorial layout designed for a newspaper-style article about artist Armande Barthe. The objective was to build a coherent publication spread using existing visual elements from her work, focusing on typographic hierarchy, composition, readability, and visual consistency. The layout combines text and imagery to clearly present the artist’s identity and practice, and the final result was integrated into a collective editorial publication created with the entire group.

projects.title: Monogramme
projects.description: A graphic design exercise focused on creating a personal monogram by assembling and structuring my initials into a coherent vector symbol.

projects.title: Strasbourg letters
projects.description: An alphabet created from typographic photographs collected during a school trip to Strasbourg. Each letter is sourced from existing signage and lettering found in the city, forming a compilation of diverse typographic styles. The work focuses on observation, selection, visual consistency, and graphic classification, and the final result was assembled into a printed editorial edition bringing together all collected letters.

projects.title: Projet photography
projects.description: Photographed assigned projects to amplify their original graphic concept.

projects.title: Visual identity - Ayamaya
projects.description: Designed a logo and visual identity for Mollis, an ergonomic cushion brand. Developed a complete brand guideline illustrating logo usage, typography, color palette, and application across various touchpoints. The project was created in direct collaboration with the brand.

projects.title: Short film - 'Ce qui reste'
projects.description: Created a short film exploring the concept of “roots” as invisible links and personal memory. The narrative focuses on a young girl reconnecting with a lost loved one through a recurring object. The project included full production: idea development, research, storyboard, shooting, lighting setup, and sound design. Post-production involved editing, color grading, and visual effects to emphasize narrative and emotional impact.

projects.title: Body stop motion
projects.description: Created a stop-motion animation using the body to visually interpret a given sound. Focused on representing the rhythm and movement of a person walking in a supermarket.

projects.title: Urban swimming
projects.description: Created an After Effects animation illustrating a sound from a documentary about urban swimming.

projects.title: Moji x Sboy - Fête de la musique
projects.description: Photographed the Moji x Sboy performance at Place des Vosges during Fête de la Musique. Captured moments before, during, and after the show to document the event and artist performence.
